source: A unique name for this item. It must only contain lowercase letters, numbers, underscores, and semicolons.
Allows clients to receive an access token without the need for an authorization request token.
Always issue a new refresh token after the existing one has been used
Are you sure you want to delete the OAuth2 server %name?
Are you sure you want to delete the OAuth2 server client %name?
Are you sure you want to delete the OAuth2 server scope %name?
Are you sure you want to disable the OAuth2 server %name?
Deleting a client will disable all connectivity to it.
Deleting a scope will disable all connectivity to the scope.
Deleting a server will disable all its scopes and clients.
Disabling a server will also disable all attached scopes and clients. This action cannot be undone.
Enter the displayed name for the server.
Leave this blank, and leave "Require a client secret" checked, to use the previously saved secret.
Manage servers and their associated clients and scopes.
Only enabled servers can be used for OAuth2.
Property of user object to use
Require the redirect url to be an exact match of the client's redirect url. If not enabled, the redirect url in the request can contain additional segments, such as a query string.
Sends encrypted JWT access tokens that aren't stored in the database.
The JWT subject, usually a username or email.
The OAuth2 Client of the client.
The OAuth2 server %name has been deleted.
The OAuth2 server %name has been disabled.
The OAuth2 server %name has been enabled.
The OAuth2 server client %name has been deleted.
The OAuth2 server scope %name has been deleted.
The Unix timestamp when the JTI expires.
The Unix timestamp when the token expires.
The Unix timestamp when the token was last used.
The absolute URI to redirect to after authorization.
The absolute URIs to validate against. Enter one value per line.
The client configuration has been saved.
The human-readable name of this client.
The id token, if OpenID Connect was used.
The name of the providing module.
The number of seconds the ID token will be valid for.
The number of seconds the access token will be valid for.
The number of seconds the refresh token will be valid for. 0 for forever.
The scope configuration has been saved.
The scopes of the authorization code.
The server configuration has been saved.
The type of the token (access, refresh).
The user of the resource owner.

Unset (delete) the refresh token after it has been used
Used to decode the JWT when the %JWT grant type is used.
Used to describe the scope to the user on the authorization form.
